page.title: 09Bickham House (1).
page.content: Bickham House, owned by the Lopes family, was built approximately 100 years ago on the sight of an earlier 'William and Mary' house of the 'Gill' family, bankers from Plymouth. It is believed that William Morris was involved in the building of the property. There remains a window in the house designed by this man. After the war the present Lord Roborough's father bought the property rather than see the area spoilt by development although, at that time, he had no intention of living there as Roborough House was the 'dower' house. The estate and house continue to be passed down through the family. The expense and hardwork of maintaining the house is shared by the whole family. The house is occupied by Lord Roborough's son the Rt Hon' Henry Lopes his wife and family.
